info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 11:15AM CDT until April 19 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Texas. In southwest Missouri, Webster and Wright.
* WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1115 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Whetstone Creek at Owens Road, Woods Fork Gasconade River at Rippee Ford Road, James River at Bell Ford Road, Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road, Finley River at Highway Z, Wolf Creek at Highway AB and Elk Creek at Highway Z. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marshfield, Mountain Grove, Rogersville, Seymour, Mansfield, Fordland, Norwood, Hartville, Niangua, Diggins, Dawson, Duncan, Odin, Grovespring, Rader, Manes, Northview, Graff and Elkland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Texas, MO; Webster, MO; Wright, MO
